name: Buffalo Chicken Balls
author: doconez
summary: I bring these to several parties throughout the year with rave reviews. It's really a take on Buffalo chicken wings. I keep getting requests for them all the time. Serve with toothpicks and blue cheese dressing.
ingredients: ⅓ cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Combine ground chicken, bread crumbs, celery, and egg in a bowl
Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat; stir in hot sauce
Pour into chicken mixture; knead until well incorporated
Season mixture with salt and pepper
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Spray a large baking dish with cooking spray
Roll chicken mixture into 1-inch balls; place in a single layer on baking dish
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 30 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
Remove from oven and rest for 5 minutes before serving
